abstract: The car-sharing company and General Motors are working together to make sharing easier.
snippet: The car-sharing company and General Motors are working together to make sharing easier.
lead_paragraph: General Motors and RelayRides, a peer-to-peer car-sharing service that allows private car owners to rent their vehicles, announced a partnership and possible investment this week. Under an exclusive two-year agreement, RelayRides users will be able to unlock G.M. vehicles that are registered with the car-sharing service and subscribed to OnStar, the automaker's communication service, with a mobile phone app.

headline.main: RelayRides Gets a Lift From G.M.'s OnStar
